This functionality can be used by external auditors who wish to examine or analyse system activity.
The System must at a minimum be able to provide reports for actions on cases organised.
The System should be able to provide reports for actions on cases organised by workstation and (where technically appropriate) by network address.
Defense Attorney, Person qualified and appointed to represent a Defendant in an adversarial judicial proceeding
The System must allow only admin-users to set up user profiles and allocate users to groups.

The system shall read this file and the definitions shall be derived from the initialization data in the file.
The THEMAS system shall use the information contained in the initialization data file to determine which heating and cooling units are part of the THEMAS system.
The Clarus system shall be able to receive roadway weather measurements derived from VII data.
The Clarus system shall accept environmental data from emergency vehicles.
The Clarus system shall be able to receive weather data from weather service providers.
The Clarus system shall provide notification of data quality conditions to data collectors.
The Clarus system shall not modify original observations.
The Clarus system shall be able to implement quality control rules for each environmental parameter.
The Clarus system shall be able to base its quality control process on historical environmental data.
The Clarus system shall be able to provide sensor equipment data in response to a request.
The MultiMahjongServer will allow players on MultiMahjongClient programs to modify their own names and icons during gameplay (as opposed to only at the beginning).
When a user creates a new single player game, they must enter their name, choose an icon from a predetermined list and set the score limit for winning a hand of Mahjong.
The Clarus system shall not require approval to request environmental data.
The Clarus system shall record statistics about its operation.
Users who create a new game will be able to choose to play different variations of Mahjong rules other than those described.
The Clarus system shall log data transactions.
The MultiMahjongClient must only allow players to make moves according to the Chinese rules of Mahjong as described in the rulebook, "How to Play Mah Jong".
The Clarus system shall acquire, process, and disseminate atmospheric data.

If the configurations of: the current discard, the tiles in a user's hand, and the player whose turn it is, would allow the user to Chow/Pung/Kong/Mahjong under the Chinese rules of Mahjong, the MultiMahjongClient will inform the user that they can do so.
User's will be able to pick up a tile from the wall if it is their turn.
The Clarus system shall acquire, process, and disseminate surface metadata.
The Clarus system shall be able to acquire, process, and disseminate environmental data from across North America.
The Clarus system shall be able to collect environmental data that are manually entered.
The Clarus system shall transfer data as efficiently as possible.
The Clarus system shall employ industry standards to minimize implementation impact to users and providers.
The Clarus system shall respond to queries for environmental data from the available data.
If a user leaves the game prematurely, a new CO is created on another user's machine to fill their place.

The TCS shall have the functionality to connect to the power supply equipment provided in the TCS operating environment.

Each voucher should have two portions with three tear off voucher slips each for Client and Partner.

All employees shall be allowed to use the Daily Reminders.
Systems supporting OM must have the ability to print questionnaires for multiple uses, including taking to the field, use during phone interviews, etc.
Systems supporting OM should track the changes made to the status of case records as a result of changes in the case definition.

The system shall send an order confirmation to the user through email.
The system shall enable user to select the shipping method during payment process.
The system shall allow user to enter the order information for tracking.

The system shall allow user to select the payment method for order.
The system shall display the orders that are eligible to change.
The system shall allow user to select the order to be changed.

The system shall display all the available financing options.

The system shall enable user to enter the payment information.
The system shall provide a digital image for each product in the product catalog.
The performance shall depend upon hardware components of the client/customer.
The system shall not leave any cookies on the customer’s computer containing any of the user’s confidential information.
The system shall allow a user to make public emergency point-to-point voice calls.
ETCS shall be compatible with existing national systems listed in the CCS TSI such that it does not interfere with the national systems and is not interfered with by the national systems.
The ETCS on-board shall be capable of receiving National values from the trackside to adapt to National requirements.
The DUAP Input Services shall be able to collect probe vehicle data from Detroit Department of Transportation (DDOT) Transit using the DDOT interface.
The DUAP Input Services shall be able to collect probe vehicle data from truck fleets using the truck fleets’ interfaces.
The DUAP System shall be able to collect weather data.
The DUAP Input Services shall be able to collect Clarus weather data as enumerated in APPENDIX D -Weather Data Elements from Clarus.
The DUAP System shall be able to collect Origin/Destination (O/D) data.
The DUAP Input Services shall be able to collect roadway traffic data from the Road Commission of Macomb County (RCMC) system using the RCMC system interface.
The DUAP System shall be able to collect work zone (lane closure) data.
The DUAP System shall derive traffic data from probe vehicle data.
The DUAP Output Services shall be able to publish traffic data in the SimTraffic traffic analysis tool SimTraffic interface format.
The System shall provide the capability to operate in a Restricted Access Mode, within which only users meeting certain criteria will be authorized access to the data.
The System shall be capable of maintaining records of at least 30 days (configurable) worth of Ingest history.
The System shall provide the capability to control the execution of Scientific Algorithms.
Supports workflow of digital objects in this order:
Review content as a method of the selection process
Prompts a request for resubmission to the Content Originator if an error of transmission or receipt occurs
Transmission problems allow rejection of entire packages.
Accommodates a resubmitted SIP in case of errors resulting from the SIP submission.
Has the option of sending a configurable automatic system confirmation receipt of SIP to producer based on type of resource, file, producer, etc.
Validates automatically the successful transfer of the SIP to a staging area using Cyclic Redundancy Check (CRCs) or checksums associated with each data file.
Conforms to NLM security policies and requirements to ensure the appropriate level of protection for the AIPs.
Provides internal validation such as referential integrity of the contents of the database.
Creates and maintains schema or table definitions required to support Data Management functions.
Query requests are received from other functions (for example, Ingest, Access, and Administration).
Has capability to generate and provide management reports and statistics such as summaries of updates by category, user codes, etc.
Audits submissions to ensure that they meet archive/repository standards.
Keeps an audit trail of all actions.
Summarizes reports and provides repository performance information and repository holdings inventory reports to Preservation Planning.
Updates contents of DIPs and resubmits them as SIPs to Ingest.
Deletes AIPs from the repository. This may require the removal of the digital object’s files, and the retention of associated metadata, or the removal of both the files and metadata.
One of the fundamental tasks of the system is to allow actors to upload and manage files on certain pages of the system.
Voice clips should be downloadable for archival purposes or for the purpose of presenting them to other actors.
Actors in the course administrator role may not feel the need to provide web feeds for every page in their course.
The course administrator should also be able to attach feedback in the form of text or an attachment (as described above).
The system should display grade information such as the grade for each assignment, averages, and overall grade to the actor to whom the grades belong.
the actor in the role of course administrator should be able to toggle whether notifications are turned on.
A system will be considered to meet this requirement if it has a single administrative interface rather than individual links for editing each page.
The system must be backed up on a configurable schedule.
System administrators must have access to comprehensive, searchable documentation.
Users must have easy access to help while interacting with the system.
The system will provide tools to assist in studies analyzing impacts of changing demographics and economic conditions on water use within the SWUCA.
Identify when a standby permit is reactivated due to the loss of alternative quantities.
Testing records shall include the dates of the tests, the duration of the tests, and an indication of whether the tests met the requirements of this Black Start Testing section.
The Black Start unit must be equipped with governors that are capable of operating in an isochronous mode.
The CAISO shall from time to time undertake performance tests, with or without prior notification.
The CAISO shall have the sole right to determine when the operation of Black Start Generating Unit is required to respond to conditions on the CAISO Controlled Grid.

Web server sends initialization request to the mediator to trigger peering.
If the user requests can not be accepted according the provider policies, service requirements are not passed to the local Peering Agent.
Local Peering Agent receives service requirements from the mediator.
Peering Agent exchange content availability and load information to identify an optimal peer to handle user requests.

An Administrator can change the User Level of every user into any other User Level.
Director: A member of the Construction Junction staff who can perform the same Inventory Management functions as a Manager, plus view, create, modify and delete Inventory Management users.

Receiving Associate: A member of the Construction Junction staff who receives donated items at the receiving docks and performs their initial entry into the Inventory Management System and provides donors with their donation receipts.

Customer Service Representative: A member of the Construction Junction staff who works in the customer service desk and performs specific tasks such as constituent and member database management, item returns processing, creating drop-off acquisitions, and others.
The system should allow Construction Junction staff to view a list of all items that are currently flagged as blastworthy that haven‟t yet been included in an e-Blast.
The user can then select which flagged items should be included on the next e-Blast.
The system should allow Construction Junction to reward customers for frequent donating by giving them in-store credit that can be used when purchasing items.
The system shall provide an online, hierarchical, and cross-linked help system in HTML that describes and illustrates all system functions.

The system supports (but does not require) streamlined staff login methods, for example staff member swipes a card to log into a terminal or the staff member logs into a terminal by using his/her individual login and password.
System Administration Module shall use a fully relational database back-end.
System provides an administrative dashboard displaying
System provides a single console with access to all configuration files.
System provides a dedicated interface for creating new staff accounts.
System supports administrator-programmable and user-programmable macros and/or keyboard shortcuts.
System provides a user-friendly interface for designing queries against all record types.
Users can drag and drop objects (files or archives) between any computer system space and the application.

The system shall log errors, warnings, and informational messages to an external log file on the application server.
The system shall provide searching ability to the users to quickly find specific topic material through the online help tool.
The ELSS must capture all data necessary for recording the fishing activities undertaken by a UK fishing vessel.
The ELSS must output the data as an XML file for transmission to the UK fisheries administrations’ ERS system.
The ELSS must provide data capture screens for the entry of the logbook, transhipment and landing declaration data that is required to be transmitted to the UK fisheries administrations’ ERS system.
All corrections must be easily identifiable within the ELSS user interface.
The ELSS must only permit deletion messages to be generated and sent for reports sent during a current trip up to the End of Fishing report for that voyage.
The system shall include digital programmable power switches which shall be used to monitor the current state of an appliance (e.g., a coffee maker is off or on).
